column4: hi all, i'm trying to install edgy on a new system ( new to me ) and everything goes fine till i try to use the command " lspci" nothing happens. also, the realtec nic is not being detected, in fact NOTHING is being detected. is there a way to `force` edgy to detect hardwaRE?
I'd double check the install
lspci is a very low level command, it interacts with the kernel
yeah, it is downloadable
: where is this alt. cd ?
: this will detect and support my realtek nic ?
it's hard to say. Realtek NICs shouldn't have a problem.
they both use the same kernel though, so I would say probably not, but you don't have many other choices =P
the fact that lspci doesn't output anything though indicates something is wrong
: could it be the hardware isn't being detected due to some bios setting
yeah, but it should detect your chipset and everything else either way
: will lspci work in 'live' user mode ?
but you're right, bios could play a role
'live'? you mean livecd?
: yes. livecd , sorry
it should. once the kernel is loaded, there shouldn't be any problems with hardware-kernel interations
: lspci outputs nothing
try resetting your bios to default settings, and also look online to see if other people have problems using the same mobo
there's not much we can do... check the md5sum of your liveCDs as well
fair enough. i'm downloading the alt cd now to burn
or use that option at the boot menu
option ?
I seem to remember an option at the boot menu to check the integrity of the cd
i go now to reset bios to default
